alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 5:53PM EDT until August 10 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE CENTRAL CITY OF CHESAPEAKE AND THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 553 PM EDT, the public reported road closures in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Kempsville, Regent University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Great Bridge, Deep Creek, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Princess Anne, Fentress, Norfolk International, Gallups Corner, Princess Anne Plaza, London Bridge, Mount Pleasant, Bayside, Greenbrier, Oceana NAS and Oceana. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach
